originalText.text:
When I wanted to use the restroom because I was doing my laundry I informed the owner that there was barely toilet paper. He acted as if I was speaking another language besides English. Well it seems as if they're okay with Asians using the restroom but not African Americans, Hispanics or Caucasians.  Thankfully I live around the corner and can use my own clean bathroom.

Thank you.

originalText.text:
I've used the self-service machines, the wash & fold service, and dress shirt dry cleaning. There are many machines and they all seem to work well. The dry cleaning is super reliable, quick and affordable. I use it every week for my work shirts.

I really love the wash & fold. It feels like a bit of a luxury, but it's well worth the price. I'm usually pretty busy and also a bit of a procrastinator, so the wash & fold is a huge help some weeks. Instead of staying home for an afternoon, going back and forth to switch machines, I can drop it off in the morning and pick it up just a few hours later. Somehow they get the clothes cleaner than I ever can, and they're folded perfectly. All I need to do it put them in the drawers.

Lastly, it's a family business. The people who run it are friendly, honest and hardworking members of the local community. I'm glad they're here.

originalText.text: A lot of the machines are either broken or looks dirty.  Not sure if they ever cleans the machines.  There was also a lady who is the owner or just works there folding clothes with a kid who always step in the cart and folding tables with his shoes on.

originalText.text: üòù Best in town. I've been going there for over 7yrs. Never used their drop off service but they are courteous, professional and most importantly, the vibe! You can stay in your peace of mind here. ü•∞The machine washes fast so don't be gone long. Also I'm sure if you leave a tip and ask for an employee to fit your stuff in a dryer, then anyone of the employees will help out. Also everything is self service and easily to navigate. There is also a back yard for you smokers or to rest your excess luggage/shopping cart, when doing laundry.

originalText.text: $3 for a regular machine (which is a bit higher compared to the other laundromat in the area), $6 for a large one and 6 minutes per quarter for the dryers. It has a nice backyard where you can go and wait while your clothes are being washed or dried. They have few chairs where you can sit. I'm really glad this laundromat is still open during this pandemic while almost all the other ones are closed.
